commentary_data: Squad: Harry Brook, Mayank Agarwal, Rahul Tripathi, Aiden Markram(c), Heinrich Klaasen(w), Washington Sundar, Marco Jansen, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Mayank Markande, Umran Malik, T Natarajan, Adil Rashid, Akeal Hosein, Glenn Phillips, Samarth Vyas, Anmolpreet Singh, Mayank Dagar, Upendra Yadav, Abhishek Sharma, Kartik Tyagi, Sanvir Singh, Fazalhaq Farooqi, Abdul Samad, Nitish Reddy, Vivrant Sharma

It is Kolkata versus Hyderabad today, and the winner gets the crown for the best biryani. Nope, just kidding… That’s a debate that’ll rage on for eternity, but one debate that will surely be settled tonight is who gets the two points. And those could be two valuable points to gain some winning momentum as the games arrive thick and fast in the IPL.

First to the hosts, who would be on cloud nine after that extra terrestrial last over performance by Rinku Singh in their previous game. Despite missing their skipper Shreyas Iyer and having a misfiring Andre Russell, KKR would be very pleased with the performance of their Indian core. Venkatesh Iyer, Nitish Rana and Rinku Singh were the heroes in their previous game, and add to that the explosiveness of Rahmanullah Gurbaz and possibly Jason Roy up top, Kolkata are really building a solid team. They also have the spin attack for their home venue, with two mystery spinners who continue to trick opposition batters, and Suyash Sharma being a handy auxiliary option.

Sunrisers Hyderabad didn’t just lose their first two games, but lost them in a demoralizing fashion. They however responded well with a clinical performance and win against PBKS on their home turf. The return of Aiden Markram and Marco Jansen has greatly strengthened the team in Orange, and they’d hope to build on that momentum with another good performance today. The good news for them is Rahul Tripathi is back amongst the runs again, while Bhuvi Kumar is swinging the new ball and Nattu is nailing the yorkers. We’re just a few moments away from the toss, stick around for more updates…

The weather is a little bit muggy, so the comfort levels of players are going to be tested. In terms of ground dimensions, it is a 75m straight boundary, but the square boundaries are shorter at 64m and 65m. That means a lot of sixes, says . The pitch has taken me by surprise. Last game against RCB it was all about the spinners so I thought we would see a shaven pitch with a lot of grass but this pitch is hard and it will hold true. Someone like Umran Malik might enjoy this, and the rest of the pacers who could get good bounce on this wicket. But don’t ball short on this wicket, because the side boundaries are really short. I had a piece prepared for the pitch report for spin, butB2$ You can expect a lot of runs, a batter won’t be too worried looking at this wicket, says

Body feels good, nice to have a run around in Ahmedabad. Had a hamstring issue coming into the competition, but now it feels okay. It is all about execution in T20s, if you can nail your yorkers and nail the slower balls and commit to them then you can come out on top. Planning is tough because every bowler bowls differently, we look at the strengths and weaknesses of the opposition to work out how things are going to be. (On win against GT) It was a great game, but we need to stay consistent throughout the comp. I’m sure it will be an exciting game today as well.

I feel I'm bowling alright, but not getting many wickets. So while I'm economical in powerplay, it'll be great if I can pick up one or two wickets up front. That's what the team expects from me. And that's what I did last year. Not everyone is going to fire in the same game. Main thing is that if 2-3 players are having a good day, they should finish the game. I wasn't trying to get a single on that ball. My effort was to hit a six or four. But that was Rinku's day. It was meant to be.

Happy that I got to contribute in the last game, would like to repeat the same process. Good to get runs under my belt. Today is a different venue, different opposition so it is a new challenge. I played the situation better in the last game, the first quick I was out too quick, the second game there was a difficult wicket but the other day our bowlers did well so the target was always in our sight. T20 is about taking those risks, and putting the bowler under pressure.
We'll bowl first. We've been practicing here and there has been dew. Keeping in mind, we want to chase. Same XI for today.

Happy either way. Would have looked to bowl, that is the trend. This is a high scoring wicket, so happy to get runs on the board. Nice to get a win, and today is a fresh start. Hopefully we can do well. One change,  I don't think we'll set a target, you need to look at the pitch and then reassess. Whatever we get we'll try our best to defend.
(Playing XI): Rahmanullah Gurbaz(w), N Jagadeesan, Nitish Rana(c), Rinku Singh, Andre Russell, Sunil Narine, Shardul Thakur, Umesh Yadav, Suyash Sharma, Lockie Ferguson, Varun Chakaravarthy
(Playing XI): Harry Brook, Mayank Agarwal, Rahul Tripathi, Aiden Markram(c), Abhishek Sharma, Heinrich Klaasen(w), Marco Jansen, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Mayank Markande, Umran Malik, T Natarajan
It will be intriguing to see how Sunrisers Hyderabad's batting lineup copes with KKR's spin attack.
Mandeep Singh, Anukul Roy, Venkatesh Iyer, David Wiese, Kulwant Khejroliya
Abdul Samad, Vivrant Sharma, Glenn Phillips, Mayank Dagar, Washington Sundar
The umpires walk out followed by the players. Interesting to see Harry Brook continue to open, despite Abhishek Sharma coming back into the team. Umesh Yadav has the new ball...
Umesh Yadav to Harry Brook, , full and very wide, some swing as well. Harry Brook throws his bat on the drive and gets this through covers. Uppish but in the gap and races away for four..
Umesh Yadav to Harry Brook, , full and very wide, some swing as well. Harry Brook throws his bat on the drive and gets this through covers. Uppish but in the gap and races away for four..
Umesh Yadav to Harry Brook, 1 run, back of a length, nipped in from off. Off the thigh pad to the leg side and the batters steal a leg bye
Umesh Yadav to Mayank, 1 run, good length and nipping onto the pads, Agarwal with a gentle tap towards mid-wicket to get off the mark

Umesh Yadav to Harry Brook, , short of length, didn't have the menacing pace for a man who's grown up playing bowlers way quicker than this. Brook with an elegant pull in front of square, in the gap and four more...
Mid-wicket in place now

Umesh Yadav to Harry Brook, , cheeky!! This was full at the stumps, Brook shuffles in and ramps it to the right of short fine for a boundary. Shot of confidence, shot of a man who's buzzing after two early boundaries!!
Umesh Yadav to Harry Brook, no run, attempted bouncer that looked like it went down leg. But the umpire decides to be lenient.
Ferguson to Mayank, 3 runs, full with a bit of inwards angle, Agarwal pushes it between mid-on and mid-wicket. Chakravarthy chases after and does enough to save a run for his side...
Ferguson to Harry Brook, 1 run, back of length on the rib cage, turned towards deep square
Ferguson to Mayank, no run, fraction short outside off, a bit of wobble. No shot offered by Mayank
Ferguson to Mayank, 1 run, length ball onto the thigh pad, has Mayank Agarwal jumping to push it towards deep square leg for a single
Ferguson to Harry Brook, , short pitched, too high and goes over Brook who tried to ramp it over the keeper. Goes over the keeper as well for five wides!!
Ferguson to Harry Brook, , lovely!! Brook backs away and Ferguson goes full on off. The English batter with a lovely square drive for four. He's looking in the mood today
Ferguson to Harry Brook, no run, full on off, driven very hard but straight towards extra cover. That would have stung the fielder..
Umesh Yadav to Mayank, no run, on a length and straight, punched towards Russell at covers
Umesh Yadav to Mayank, 1 run, good length on off, Agarwal dabs it late towards short third. The fielder parries it to his left and SRH take the single
Umesh Yadav to Harry Brook, 1 run, Umesh Yadav nails the yorker on off as Brook backs off. Dug out into the pitch for a single
Umesh Yadav to Mayank, 1 run, full onto the pads, push driven to the right of mid-on for a single

Umesh Yadav to Harry Brook, , Brook backs away and Umesh Yadav tries the yorker on off again. Errs his length and bowls a low full toss and Harry Brook slams it over extra cover all the way into the stands. Just using the pace of the bowler

Umesh Yadav to Harry Brook, , Brook backs away and Umesh Yadav tries the yorker on off again. Errs his length and bowls a low full toss and Harry Brook slams it over extra cover all the way into the stands. Just using the pace of the bowler

Umesh Yadav to Harry Brook, , shot of the game!!  This was a length ball with a straight line, nothing wrong with the delivery. However, Brook backs away to make room and square cuts it into the stands over deep point. Superb batting here...
No suprise to see spin early
Narine to Mayank, no run, seam up and angles into the pads, turned towards short fine
Narine to Mayank, no run, flat on off, Agarwal pushes it back to Narine
Narine to Mayank, no run, flat and onto the pads, keeps sligthly low. Agarwal went down to pull but can't connect
Narine to Mayank, 1 run, short on off, Agarwal goes back and slaps it towards long-on
Narine to Harry Brook, 1 run, flat delivery on middle, punched towards long-on off the backfoot
Narine to Mayank, 1 run, shorter length onto middle, Agarwal goes back to clip it towards mid-wicket for a single.
This is already the highest powerplay score for SRH.
Russell to Mayank,  Caught!!

Russell to Mayank,  Caught by Chakaravarthy!! Gone!! First ball wicket for Dre Russ. Why did KKR keep the ball away from him all this while? This was hitting the hard length on off, Agarwal backs away and tries to dab it past third but the fielder in the ring moves to his left and completes a fine catch.
Russell to Tripathi, , hits the hard length again but too straight. Gets some extra bounce as well to sit nicely on the shoulder for Rahul Tripathi to pull to the left of fine leg for a boundary...
Russell to Tripathi, 1 run, short on length with some width, punched towards sweeper cover
Russell to Harry Brook, , slower delivery but goes down the leg side
Russell to Harry Brook, 1 run, good length delivery on the thigh pad, turned towards deep square
Russell to Tripathi, , low full toss on the boots, clipped to the right of mid-wickt and once it has gone past the infield it runs away for four!!
Russell to Tripathi, , low full toss on the boots, clipped to the right of mid-wickt and once it has gone past the infield it runs away for four!!
Russell to Tripathi,  Caught!!

Russell to Tripathi,  Caught by Gurbaz!!  Russell off on a celebratory run. This was the effort ball, banged in short and Tripathi top-edges his pull. Keeper Gurbaz runs forward and to his left to complete a fine pouch. The two West Indian veterans have turned the tide, first Narine with a three run over and now Russell with two wickets!
Chakaravarthy to Harry Brook, 1 run, half tracker onto leg, pulled towards deep square
Chakaravarthy to Markram, 1 run, tossed up and spins away, Markram leans wide to drive towards backward point for a quick run
KKR KKR chants getting louder...
Chakaravarthy to Harry Brook, , flat delivery that goes down leg. Brook tried to slap it away and the keeper appeals for a caught behind. Umpire however calls wide...
Chakaravarthy to Harry Brook, no run, flat delivery that spun in sharply, strikes Brook on the pads
Chakaravarthy to Harry Brook, , short and wide, cut between point and covers. Could have and should have been stopped, but the fielder dives over the ball and that runs away for four...
Chakaravarthy to Harry Brook, 1 run, pushed quicker and turning in. Brook wasn't sure so went back and turned it leg side after the spin
Chakaravarthy to Markram, no run, fuller on off, driven but in the direction of wide mid-off.
Russell to Harry Brook, 1 run, fuller and skids onto off, Brook with a tap and run towards point
Russell to Markram, no run, full and straight, driven into the pitch and back to Russell
Russell to Markram, 1 run, back of length on the body, a slightly awkward pull towards deep square leg. Just a single
Oops, Russell down on his haunches, struggling with something...Is that why KKR were holding him back all these games? Luckily, he's back up. Might just be exhaustion
Russell to Harry Brook, 1 run, fuller on the pads, clipped towards deep square
Russell to Markram, , that's more like it from the SRH skipper!! This was banged in short again, but Markram looked ready to pull it hansomely over deep square leg for a maximum
Russell to Markram, , that's more like it from the SRH skipper!! This was banged in short again, but Markram looked ready to pull it hansomely over deep square leg for a maximum
Russell to Markram, 1 run, fraction short outside off, Markram with a jumping backfoot punch towards the sweeper
Russell going off the field now. Just to catch his breath hopefully... We'll keep you updated
Chakaravarthy to Markram, 1 run, flat delivery on off, punched down towards long-on
Chakaravarthy to Harry Brook, 1 run, once again flat, this time on middle. Brook pulls it towards deep mid-wicket
Chakaravarthy to Markram, 1 run, a bit of flight on off, got some extra bounce. Markram was cautious to punch towards sweeper cover
Chakaravarthy to Harry Brook, no run, pushed fuller and quicker, Brook defends
Chakaravarthy to Harry Brook, 1 run, flighted up and spinning in, Brook drives it down the ground to long-on
Chakaravarthy to Markram, 1 run, very full on off, Markram drives towards deep extra cover.
Narine to Markram, 1 run, pitched up and turns towards the batter, Markram gets it line to push it down to long-on
Narine to Harry Brook, no run, flat and onto the pads, Brook gets a bottom edge that goes between his pads to the leg side
Narine to Harry Brook, no run, flighted up, Brook gets closer to drive but towards extra cover
Narine to Harry Brook, 1 run, pushed quicker on middle, driven towards long-on
Narine to Markram, , fired in but just down the leg side. Markram lets it pass
Narine to Markram, 1 run, pitched up, Markram cleared his leg for a big slog. Thick inside edge towards deep square leg
Narine to Harry Brook, 1 run, flat and straight line, Brook pushes it down to long-on

An eventful first nine overs, the first real sign of Harry Brook's imperious talent in the IPL. He took on the pacers in the powerplay and is looking good. For KKR, it was a return of one of their veterans Andre Russell, this time with the ball that got them two wickets. Tripathi was out cheaply, and Mayank Agarwal's lean patch continues. Let's see how the game continues...
Suyash Sharma to Harry Brook, no run, tossed up but was the googly. Brook almost chopped on!! Luckily the ball is stopped by his back pad
Suyash Sharma to Harry Brook, no run, dropped!! This was a half tracker, Brook went back and slapped it hard straight back at the bowler. Didn't stick...
Suyash Sharma to Harry Brook, 2 runs, tossed up on middle and leg, Brook turns it softly towards mid-wicket to return for the second run..
Suyash Sharma to Harry Brook, 1 run, flat outside off, Brook undercuts it into the ground towards short third
Suyash Sharma to Markram, no run, flat outside off, spun in slightly. Markram tried to cut away but missed

Suyash Sharma to Markram, , tossed up on off, Markram decided he had to go for the big shot. Looked like a mistimed one but got enough meat behind his big drive to clear long-off. A very welcome six!!
Narine to Harry Brook, 1 run, pushed fuller, driven towards long-on
Narine to Markram, 1 run, fuller and spinning in, Markram takes in on the bounce and drives straight for a single
Narine to Harry Brook, 1 run, flat outside off, Brook goes back to turn it towards deep mid-wicket.
Narine to Markram, no run, full on the pads, turned towards short fine but the fielder is onto it quickly to deny the single...
Narine to Markram, 2 runs, flat delivery on off, Markram goes back and taps it towards deep mid-wicket. Hit with soft hands to enable a couple of runs
Narine to Markram, 1 run, flat delivery again, Markram off the backfoot turns it to long-on
Suyash Sharma to Markram, , tossed up on off, Markram takes it on the bounces and heaves it over deep extra cover. All muscle on that one to clear the fence...
Suyash Sharma to Markram, no run, flat delivery, goes over Markram's bat on the cut

Suyash Sharma to Markram, , out of here!! A bit of a half-tracker, and it spun in. Markram rocks back really quickly to pull it over deep mid-wicket. Superb hit, the speed with which he judged length was incredible...
Suyash Sharma to Markram, no run, googly from a length. Markram goes back but is forced to cut it into the pitch
Suyash Sharma to Markram, , tossed up on middle, Markram decided early he was going to bring out the reverse and stuck to it. Over backward point and races away to the fence...
Suyash Sharma to Markram, no run, short on off, cut hard but towards point
ICYMI, no sign of Shardul Thakur yet with the ball. He is playing the game and on the field, I just checked.
ICYMI, no sign of Shardul Thakur yet with the ball. He is playing the game and on the field, I just checked.
Chakaravarthy to Harry Brook, 2 runs, flat and spinning in, Brook goes back and slaps it between deep mid-wicket and long-on. Two runs taken
Chakaravarthy to Harry Brook, 1 run, flat onto middle, turned towards deep mid-wicket
Chakaravarthy to Markram, , short and pushed wider. Markram danced out and slapped this one hard to the left of long-off. A bit of ordinary fielding there from Umesh leads to a boundary

Chakaravarthy to Markram, , take that!! What a way to get to fifty. Chakaravarthy goes quicker and on middle, right as per plan for Markram who clears his legs out the way and slogs it deep into the stands beyond deep mid-wicket!!
Chakaravarthy to Markram,  Caught!!

Chakaravarthy to Markram,  Caught by Russell!! Fifty and out!! This was pitched up again, some gutsy bowling from Chakaravarthy. Markram couldn't resist the big slog once again, but gets more elevation than distance. Holes out towards cow corner where Russell takes a fine catch.
A slip in place
Chakaravarthy to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run, fuller on off, Abhishek Sharma with a tentative push towards sweeper cover
Very interesting approach from Brook. Almost has shut shop after the initial burst. Looks like he is waiting for pace at the end
Suyash Sharma to Abhishek Sharma, no run, googly outside off stump, Abhishek slices this towards point

Suyash Sharma to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run, . Very casual from Shardul. Two chances down off Suyash Sharma's bowling. One put down by himself, now Shardul. Googly outside off stump, Abhishek goes for the loft and slices towards deep cover. Shardul attacks the catch, coulnd't control the momentum of the run and it burst through his hands
Suyash Sharma to Harry Brook, 1 run, calming back foot nudge to long-on
Suyash Sharma to Abhishek Sharma, no run, blocked towards point
Suyash Sharma to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run, punched to deep cover
Suyash Sharma to Harry Brook, 1 run, I am only going to nudge the spinner kind of tuck to mid-wicket and he will keep strike

. Six overs to go. Abhishek can't build dots here. The problem for SRH is how early is too early to attack. If they let KKR back in with a quick couple of wickets now they could finish well below par. This game is nicely poised. KKR have managed to put pressure back on SRH through spin.
Bring on Lord Shardul the partnership breaker!!!!
Pace on, Brook might be shifting gears this over.
Pace on, Brook might be shifting gears this over.

Ferguson to Harry Brook, , my my my! Ferguson has a what have I done wrong here face! He bowled a slower ball, maybe it was in the slot, but Brook did pick this right out of the hands. Absolutely no signs of playing early. Brought the bat down in clean motion and through the line for a massive lofted drive over long-off. The shot of the day!

Ferguson to Harry Brook, no run, good review from Brook. Immediate review and UltraEdge is flat. There was a definite sound, wonder where that came from. Slower delivery, Brook moved off-side to scoop, missed it completely and reverses the call with DRS
Ferguson to Harry Brook, , full toss, yeah smash me ball. Mid-off in, Book says I got to do nothing fancy here and places the loft easily over mid-off for four more!
Ferguson to Harry Brook, , , another full toss, this time pace off but doesn't matter as Brook slices it past point for four more. This is really poor bowling from such an experienced campaigner

Ferguson to Harry Brook, , brilliant! Absolutely brilliant from Brook. Deft touch too. Slower delivery, Brook moved across, but he ensured he met the ball gently to ensure it splits keeper and short fine leg to perfection
Ferguson to Harry Brook, no run, beaten! Cramped him for room with a short of length delivery, Brook backs away and misses
Ferguson to Harry Brook, , what an over! Short and wide, no one at third man, hit me ball and Brook cuts it easily for four. 23 off that over. SRH are motoring along nicely

Suyash Sharma to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run, sliced away over backward point for a couple of runs. Shouts of catch it, but it cleared the infield. Looks like Abhishek hasn't landed his bat inside the crease trying to return for the second run. Yes, one short!
Suyash Sharma to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run, googly, Abhishek lofts the drive to long-off

Suyash Sharma to Harry Brook, , that could have been another caught and bowled, but Suyash Sharma thought I am not risking losing my fingers. Powered hard down the ground off the back foot, ump got out of sight quickly, bowler stood unmoved
Suyash Sharma to Harry Brook, 1 run, googly, Brook punches it to long-on
Suyash Sharma to Abhishek Sharma, , sliced away nicely, beats backward point, tease for the fielder in the deep and he loses despite the dive
Suyash Sharma to Abhishek Sharma, , googly, Abhishek advances and lofts the drive over extra-cover. Picked that out of the hands and easily hit that. 15-run over. SRH on course for 210+
Narine to Harry Brook, 1 run, short delivery, keeps low, Brook pulls and hits it on the bounce to long-on
Harry Brook is looking ominous now! Beware KKR bowlers, beware! Looking set for a maiden IPL century.
Narine to Abhishek Sharma, , short and wide, cut away past backward point and that bad ball has been punished
Narine to Abhishek Sharma, no run, quicker delivery, Abhishek slices it to point
Narine to Abhishek Sharma, no run, quicker delivery, Abhishek slices it to point
Narine to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run, driven to long-on
Narine to Harry Brook, 1 run, dragged to long-on carefully
Narine to Abhishek Sharma, , fired wide
Narine to Abhishek Sharma, , goes full and straight for the first time to Abhishek in this over and it's a lofted drive way over long-on. What a finish, spoils Narine's figures a bit
Chakaravarthy to Harry Brook, 1 run, quicker delivery, Harry knocks it to long-on
Chakaravarthy to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run, quicker delivery, Abhishek pulls to deep mid-wicket
Chakaravarthy to Harry Brook, 1 run, shortish delivery, Brook works it to long-on. Thinks of two, decides against it
Chakaravarthy to Abhishek Sharma, , slot ball, at pace, front leg out of the way and baang, over long-on. Clean swing of the bat from Abhishek
Chakaravarthy to Abhishek Sharma, 1 run, advances but Chakaravarthy cramps him for room, flicked towards deep mid-wicket

Chakaravarthy to Harry Brook, , I am afraid he will hit me down the ground, so let me not offer anything in the slot kind of ball from Chakaravarthy, but he drops it way too short for Brook to have an easy pull shot through square leg, splitting the fielders in the deep. Into the 90s. Enough time for a hundred now
Despite that 14-run over , Narine finishes conceding only 28 off his 4 overs...!! Demonstrates his class...!!
Russell to Abhishek Sharma, , way outside off stump
Very weird captaincy from Nitish Rana. Not giving Shardul a single over and after that monstrous over of Lockie throwing in the inexperienced Suyash instead of narine or chakravarthy
Russell to Abhishek Sharma,  Caught!!

Russell to Abhishek Sharma,  Caught by Thakur!! In the airrrr, taken at long-on. Oh hang on, Russell is down on the ground in pain. Looks like cramps. Short of a length delivery, Abhishek looks to loft, toe-ends it high and Shardul judges it nicely this time. Hope it's nothing serious with Dre Russ.

Russell getting help. Oh dear, ! This is why they were not bowling him. Been very injury prone and had to be protected for the last few seasons. Hope this is only cramps. Kolkata had sizzling hot temps today. Anukul Roy on as sub. Shardul will finish the over
Thakur to Klaasen, 1 run, short of length delivery on the leg stump, Klaasen works it to long-on
Thakur to Klaasen, 1 run, short of length delivery on the leg stump, Klaasen works it to long-on
Washi ready to come in as impact sub

Thakur to Harry Brook, , this is outstanding batting! Not a bad ball at all. Round the wicket yorker, Brook makes room and opens the bat face nicely to split point and cover-point. Top shot from Brook
Thakur to Harry Brook, 1 run, advances and looks to drive, toe-ends it to deep cover
Thakur to Klaasen, , top edge and over the keeper. Short of a length delivery, Klaasen slogs, gets a thick edge and gets four more for SRH. Can't do much about this as a bowler
Thakur to Klaasen, , low full toss, Klaasen flicks, tease for deep deep square leg, he runs and stretches his hand, loses the race
Harry Brook will be licking his lips when he visits M. Chinnaswamy in this form !!!!
Brook will be thinking minimum 15 runs this over

Umesh Yadav to Harry Brook, 2 runs, in the airrr, oh mishit and it lands in front of deep mid-wicket. Looks like today is Harry Brook's day. Nothing is going to stop him. What a shame it would have been had he not got that deserved hundred. Pace off from Umesh Yadav, toe-ended high and he escapes
Umesh Yadav to Harry Brook, 2 runs, hit wide of long-on, call for two and Klaasen races back. Brook struggles to get back as he is tired.

Umesh Yadav to Harry Brook, 1 run, slapped to long-on and that is a  hundred. Tests, ODIs, T20Is, IPL. Put him anywhere he will score! What a talent. He gets the first hundred of the season for us. Slower delivery, hit down the ground, call for two but there was no second. SRH dugout absolutely happy. Even the Eden Gardens crowd applauds. Takes the helmet off, soaks up the applause
Umesh Yadav to Klaasen, no run, slower delivery outside off stump, Klaasen swings and misses
Umesh Yadav to Klaasen, , full toss, Klaasen hits down the ground, wasn't middled but he manages to hit over the rope
Umesh Yadav to Klaasen, , short and wide
Umesh Yadav to Klaasen, 1 run, short delivery, Klaasen toe-ends the pull, just one run

228/4 after being asked to bat. Dew or no, SRH will take this happily. Harry Brook! They played him in the middle order and he wasn't connecting really well. He had a poor run this far playing on pitches that weren't really batter friendly, but he saw a belter of a wicket here, small boundaries too and pounced on it. KKR came with some really poor new ball bowling. But spin brought them back as Brook shut shop. Dre Russ, who hadn't bowl thus far this season, came on and struck first ball and last ball of his first over. With Brook taking a defensive approach to spin, Markram took the onus to attack and he attacked like a boss. Outscored Brook for his fifty despite the start the English youngster got. That innings was key to Brook playing through. And once pace was on in the form of Ferguson, Brook upped his gears and it didn't matter who bowled at the end as he got his hundred. The shots he played looked effortless, the ball sure flew quite a distance and some of them were absolute gold
Pitch, dew, whatever you could say, 229 is really difficult and KKR got to do a miracle against this high quality line up that SRH has. Back in 15 for the chase.

I’ve had a bit of trouble with spin, but I wanted to use the powerplay to my advantage. So middle overs wanted to rotate strike and let the other boys do the hitting. It is a belter of a pitch, we need to bowl our lengths rightly and take wickets. We still got a job to do. My girlfriend is here but the rest of my family have just left, I’m sure they’ll all be very happy for me.
Washi comes on as impact sub for Brook. Meanwhile, Venky Iyer is padded up for KKR. It's humid, watchout for Bhuvi's swing!
Bhuvneshwar to Gurbaz, no run, Gurbaz walks down the pitch to negate swing, defended
One slip in place!
Bhuvneshwar to Gurbaz, no run, swinging away outside off stump, Gurbaz lets it go
Bhuvneshwar to Gurbaz,  Caught!!

Bhuvneshwar to Gurbaz,  Caught by Umran Malik!! Hack, a proper hack and he gets an outside edge to third man. Inswinger from Bhuvneshwar. Gurbaz got tricked into a playing across the line slightly, maybe he should have just lofted that over cover. Almost a leading edge that because he swun across the, thick edge and Umran tracks it down nicely for a comfortable catch at third man. Not the start KKR wanted.
Venky Iyer in as sub
Bhuvneshwar to Venkatesh Iyer, no run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Venkatesh defends off the back foot

Bhuvneshwar to Venkatesh Iyer, leg byes, 1 run, ohh almost troubled him with a big inswinger, if only it was on target. Venkatesh crouched to play that and it made it really tough for him to connect the flick, off the thigh pad

Bhuvneshwar to N Jagadeesan, no run, Jagadeesan advances to kill some swing, taps this inswinger to mid-on. Bhuvi, when he gets swing, bowls a pretty good first over usually and starts with a maiden today
Marco Jansen to Venkatesh Iyer, no run, crunchy cover drive, straight to the fielder
Marco Jansen to Venkatesh Iyer, no run, again Iyer is troubled by the incoming angle, somehow manages to toe-end this defence as Marco Jansen targets LBW
Marco Jansen to Venkatesh Iyer, 1 run, no problems working this good length delivery away through backward square leg
Marco Jansen to N Jagadeesan, no run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Jagadeesan pushes to cover-point
Marco Jansen to N Jagadeesan, 1 run, Jagadeesan mistimes the slog to mid-wicket
Pressure building on KKR
Marco Jansen to Venkatesh Iyer, , ah missed a leg-side ball, Venky wanted to hit that to the fine leg fence
Marco Jansen to Venkatesh Iyer, no run, just a blind lofted shot. Full and outside off stump, outswing beating Venky on that occasion

Bhuvneshwar to N Jagadeesan, , in the airrrr, just out of Tripathi's dive at backward point.Good length delivery, Jagadeesan outside edges the drive, Tripathi full length to the right but it just escaped him
Bhuvneshwar to N Jagadeesan, 2 runs, advances and knocks it off the inside edge to mid-wicket
Gurbaz is good player but Roy was chasing 240 in PSL and  he has been in very good form KKR should have played him...
Bhuvneshwar to N Jagadeesan, 1 run, . Good length delivery outside off stump, Jagadeesan hits it straight back to the bowler, Bhuvneshwar wasn't expecting and he didn't have enough time to be honest

Bhuvneshwar to Venkatesh Iyer, , mishit, but Venky will take it. Looked like the slower ball, the knuckle ball, yes! Venky goes for the loft and plays a tad early, luckily the timing was good enough to clear mid-off
Bhuvneshwar to Venkatesh Iyer, no run, . Now runs at the bowler and has a big swing, totally misses
Bhuvneshwar to Venkatesh Iyer, 1 run, short of length delivery, Venkatesh cramped for room, played to mid-off

Marco Jansen to Venkatesh Iyer, , the first real well timed shot from Venkatesh. Slower delivery, was picked from the hand so Venkatesh delayed the shot to power it nicely over the bowler's head for four

Marco Jansen to Venkatesh Iyer, , the first real well timed shot from Venkatesh. Slower delivery, was picked from the hand so Venkatesh delayed the shot to power it nicely over the bowler's head for four
Marco Jansen to Venkatesh Iyer,  Caught!!

Marco Jansen to Venkatesh Iyer,  Caught by Markram!! Soft dismissal. Hit me ball down leg, Venkatesh checks his flick shot, leading edge high and a dolly for mid-on. So the impact sub not really working for KKR. SRH bossing this game.
Marco Jansen to Narine,  Caught!!

Marco Jansen to Narine,  Caught by Markram!! This is such smart bowling from Marco Jansen. 1. cramp the batters for room. 2. Also don't bowl slot.  now. KKR sent Narine up for some pinch hitting. Narine wants to go down the ground immediately and totally miscues it to mid-on. On a batting beauty to be 20/3 in the 4th over, well, can't be doing that.
Marco Jansen to Nitish Rana, no run, oh ! Full and swinging away outside off stump, Rana leans forward and drives, misses. So easily could have been the edge and a hat-trick
Marco Jansen to Nitish Rana, 1 run, knocked to mid-wicket
Marco Jansen to N Jagadeesan, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Jagadeesan taps it square of the wicket
T Natarajan to N Jagadeesan, , Jaggi opens up straightaway on arrival of his Tamil Nadu teammate Nattu. Front leg out of the way and slogged to deep mid-wicket, although not properly middled
T Natarajan to N Jagadeesan, 1 run, drags this short of length delivery to backward square leg
T Natarajan to Nitish Rana, no run, full and outside off stump, Rana drives to mid-on
T Natarajan to Nitish Rana, 1 run, full delivery outside off stump, Rana slices the drive to deep point
T Natarajan to N Jagadeesan, no run, short delivery angling across, Jagadeesan lets it go
T Natarajan to N Jagadeesan, , ah shot! Good length delivery, Jagadeesan goes down the ground and lofts it high over long-on. Jaggi started to middle them better now
Umran v Rana. How long before he bowls the short ball?

Umran Malik to Nitish Rana, , and he starts off with a first ball bouncer. Short delivery, Nitish pulls, totally rushed on the shot. Very lucky that the top edge cleared short fine leg. Umran will try again

Umran Malik to Nitish Rana, , oh, this is interesting! Rana is taking on the short ball. This wasn't all that short, Rana stood tall and smashed the pull, landed right on the cushion. This is getting spicy out there

Umran Malik to Nitish Rana, , Rana has decided I am going to try and put the pressure back on Umran knowing he's going to come hard at him. But Umran for some reason ran in and dished out a slot ball, dragged to deep mid-wicket. Rinku is smiling and clapping. Shouts of "KKR, KKR," pick up

Umran Malik to Nitish Rana, , four more! Markram surely's got to go and have a word with Umran. Pace is alright, but the length and direction is way too off. Short and wide with no off-side defence in the deep, Rana says thank you very much and smashes the cut shot over cover-point

Umran Malik to Nitish Rana, , top edgeeee, where is fine leg? How do you not have a fine leg if you are going to bowl short and this guy bowls quick for the edge to travel anyway! Short again, Rana doesn't stop himself from hacking, gets lucky with the edge as it clears short fine leg

Umran Malik to Nitish Rana, , what an outstanding shot! Rana expects short stuff, Umran Malik delivers, Rana stays back and cuts this away over backward point for a brilliant six. 28 off that over and SRH have needlessly got KKR back into the game with this poor over
Markande to N Jagadeesan, , sliced away nicely, past short third man and four more. Runs just flowing
So happy for jagadeesan , he played good knocks in domestic. finally a youngster from CSK got chance in another team.
Markande to N Jagadeesan, 1 run, knocked to mid-wicket
Markande to Nitish Rana, 1 run, flighted delivery on the stumps, Rana sweeps through backward square leg and the crowd is absolutely electric right now
Markande to N Jagadeesan, 2 runs, . What are SRH doing? Tripathi the culprit. Jagadeesan plays the slog-sweep, top edges this to deep mid-wicket. Tripathi runs in, gets both hands and spills it

Markande to N Jagadeesan, , oh what a shot! Was on the front foot, had to delay because of extra turn and flight from Markande, Jagadeesan opened the bat face last second, tease for short third man and it beats the dive
Markande to N Jagadeesan, no run, quicker delivery, Jagadeesan defends off the back foot. Eden Gardens is loud. You are missing something spectacular tonight if you are not watching this
Washington Sundar to Nitish Rana, 2 runs, 101kph, full ball sliding into the pads, Rana flicks it gently through midwicket and gets an easy two
Washington will bowl from round the wicket to the leftie
Washington Sundar to Nitish Rana, no run, length ball sliding in towards off, 101.6kph, Rana gets forward and punches to cover
Washington Sundar to Nitish Rana, no run, length ball sliding in towards off, 101.6kph, Rana gets forward and punches to cover
Washington Sundar to Nitish Rana, 1 run, 98kph, full ball fired in on middle and leg, Rana knocks it to long-on

Rahman - Gurbaz is the only specialist WK in KKR, right?
-- Jagadeesan can also keep wickets.

Washington Sundar to N Jagadeesan, , 102.8kph, length ball sliding away outside off as Washington stays round the wicket to Jagadeesan as well. This isn't all that short. But Jagadeesan backs away, makes room and slaps it through backward point
Washington Sundar to N Jagadeesan, no run, Washington continues firing them in. Close to 101kph, length ball darted across off. Jagadeesan tries using the pace to dab it fine, but he's beaten
Washington Sundar to N Jagadeesan, 1 run, length ball sliding away outside off, Jagadeesan slaps it through cover, only a single
Markande to N Jagadeesan, no run, Jagadeesan advances but he's nowhere close to the pitch of this legbreak. Pushes it back to Markande
Markande to N Jagadeesan,  Caught!!

Markande to N Jagadeesan,  Caught by (sub)Glenn Phillips!! There's some air on this leg-break, and Jagadeesan's eyes light up. He gets down low, hits the slog-sweep and holes out at deep midwicket! Struck it quite well, but just didn't get much elevation. It goes flat to the left of Phillips, the sub fielder, at deep midwicket. And he judges it well. Markande, who should've had him in his first over, gets him eventually.
Despite having Dale Steyn as your bowling coach, Umran hasn't really matured as a bowler. Another evidence that only a perfect line and length ball can get you wickets but not sheer pace.
Timeout!
Slip in place for Russell. He's scored just one run in his last two innings.
Markande to Russell, 1 run, googly on middle and leg, Russell hangs back and tucks it gently behind square
Markande to Nitish Rana, 1 run, 95kph, length ball turning in from just outside off, Rana clips it through midwicket
Markande to Russell, no run, well flighted legbreak around off, Russell gets forward and defends
Markande to Russell, no run, flat length ball sliding through on middle, Russell hangs back and blocks
Marco Jansen to Nitish Rana, no run, 135.2kph, good length delivery just outside off, Rana gets forward and defends to cover
Marco Jansen to Nitish Rana, 1 run, short of length on off, Jansen takes pace off and Rana tucks it behind square on the on-side
Marco Jansen to Russell, 1 run, big heave from Russell! Short of length into the body, he looks to muscle it out of the city but mistimes it along the ground to deep square leg
Finally DreRus gets some good amount of overs to bat but on a wrong day when RRR is already 14 in 9th over
Marco Jansen to Nitish Rana, , leg byes, 1 run, 143kph, full ball slanted down leg, Rana looks to flick it away but is hit on the pad. The hooter goes off to signal that Jansen has overstepped
Marco Jansen to Nitish Rana, , leg byes, 1 run, 143kph, full ball slanted down leg, Rana looks to flick it away but is hit on the pad. The hooter goes off to signal that Jansen has overstepped
Marco Jansen to Russell, 1 run, excellent delivery! 136.9kph, speared in close to the blockhole, and Russell drags it off a thick inside edge onto pad as he looks to slog
Marco Jansen to Nitish Rana, no run, sharp short ball at 139.4kph! It flies over Rana's left shoulder and he opts to evade, rather than take it on
Marco Jansen to Nitish Rana, , now this one's too high! Another bouncer, and it sails over Rana's head
Marco Jansen to Nitish Rana, ,  137kph, length ball around off, and Rana nails the cross-batted swipe over long-on
Markande to Russell,  Caught!!

Markande to Russell,  Caught by Marco Jansen!! Again Russell falls early to a legspinner.  Flat legbreak around leg, Russell wants to swing it down the ground but the length isn't in his half. The ball grips and holds, Russell skies it up, goes many a mile in the air, and Jansen takes such a composed catch coming in from long-on.
Rinku Singh walks out to a big ovation
Markande to Rinku Singh, 1 run, floated up outside off, quite full, and Rinku drives to long-off
Markande to Nitish Rana, no run, googly turning away off a length outside off, Rana looks to open the face and knock it through the off-side, but he's beaten by the turn! Not sure if he picked it
Markande to Nitish Rana, no run,  Lovely bowling from Markande! Tosses it up around off, Rana gets forward to defend but it spins past the edge
Markande to Nitish Rana, 1 run, knocks this googly into the off-side for one
Markande to Rinku Singh, 1 run, length ball outside off, Rinku uses his wrists nicely to clip it through midwicket
Washington Sundar to Rinku Singh, 1 run, 98.2kph, length ball sliding into the pads, Rinku looks to clip it away but it goes off an inside edge to short fine
Washington Sundar to Nitish Rana, , right in the slot for Rana! 100.2kph, fired in full around off, Rana gets forward and hammers it straight back
Washington Sundar to Nitish Rana, 2 runs, 101.3kph, full delivery drifting into off, Rana gets forward and pushes through extra cover for two!
Washington Sundar to Nitish Rana, 1 run, goes for a slog-sweep but mistimes it through midwicket
Washington Sundar to Nitish Rana, 1 run, goes for a slog-sweep but mistimes it through midwicket
Washington Sundar to Rinku Singh, 1 run, 103.7kph, flat length ball outside off, Rinku cuts it through point
Washington Sundar to Nitish Rana, 1 run, 103.4kph, full delivery just outside off, Rana gets low and sweeps to deep backward square
Markande to Nitish Rana, 2 runs, googly on off, Rana tries a reverse-sweep and manages to get it quite fine. Chase for short third man who does well to cut it off

Markande to Nitish Rana, , ah that's too full, and Rana is hitting it too well to miss out! Floated up on off, doesn't matter which way it's turning because it's so full, and Rana lofts it for a big six

Markande to Nitish Rana, 1 run, goes for a reverse-sweep but is hit on the pad! Markande goes up in appeal! Think he's got bat on it though. Oh yes, the umpire gives it as runs, and SRH don't challenge the call either
Markande to Rinku Singh, 1 run, steps out, gets too close to the pitch and drills it to long-on
Markande to Nitish Rana, no run, goes for the reverse-sweep, hits it well but finds backward point
Markande to Nitish Rana, no run, googly outside off, turns away off a length, Rana looks to cut but is beaten!
T Natarajan to Rinku Singh, 1 run, back of a length delivery slanted in on leg, Rinku plays a short-arm jab and mistimes it through square leg
T Natarajan to Nitish Rana, 1 run, 131.1kph, pitched right up on off, Rana squeezes it to long-on
T Natarajan to Rinku Singh, no run, 135kph, overpitched on leg stump, Rinku flicks it to square leg

T Natarajan to Rinku Singh, , ah there we go again! Rinku Singh clearing the boundary! Full in the slot around off, Rinku clears the front leg and hammers it over long-on. It goes way back in the stands
Chants of Rinku, Rinku from this packed crowd
T Natarajan to Rinku Singh, , banged in short, too high, sails over Rinku's head
T Natarajan to Rinku Singh, 1 run, 133.6kph, almost in the blockhole on off, Rinku squeezes it to long-off

T Natarajan to Nitish Rana, , makes room to drive through extra cover. Instead it goes running away off a thick inside edge through square leg. Natarajan can only stand with his hands on hips. He did well to follow Rana with a full delivery, inducing the error, but it still finds the ropes
Bhuvneshwar to Rinku Singh, no run, slower length ball wide of off, Rinku reaches out and mistimes the cut to point
Bhuvneshwar to Rinku Singh, no run, slower length ball wide of off, Rinku reaches out and mistimes the cut to point

Bhuvneshwar to Rinku Singh, no run,  Massive moment in this game! It's a very full delivery around middle, Rinku swings across the line, he's early through the shot and it takes the toe-end. But it bounces straight into the pitch before going to the keeper. The decision will be reversed, much to the delight of the crowd
Bhuvneshwar to Rinku Singh, , low full toss on the pads, Rinku flicks it nicely and gets it away past short fine!
Bhuvneshwar to Rinku Singh, 1 run, wide yorker outside off, Rinku reaches out and squeezes it to short third off the toe-end
Bhuvneshwar to Nitish Rana, 1 run, slower length ball outside off, Rana looks to slog and drags it off the inside half to deep midwicket
Bhuvneshwar to Rinku Singh, 1 run, slower length ball outside off, Rinku flat-bats it to long-off for a single. Just 7 off the over with the asking rate now over 17
After what he did the last match, you're almost scared to ask how much is too much. But with 87 needed off 30, it does look like too much to do.
Honestly it's time to give chance to Wiese in place of Russell. Most importantly he can bowl full quota of his over and he can finish the game
Marco Jansen to Rinku Singh, 1 run, Rinku steps out, backs away and Jansen does a brilliant job following him. Low full toss on the pads, Rinku is rushed on the shot, chips it in the air and it
Marco Jansen to Nitish Rana, , full toss down the leg-side, Rana swings and misses
Marco Jansen to Nitish Rana, no run, banged in short, might've been a cutter from Jansen and Rana is through the pull too early! He doesn't make contact as it dies through to the keeper

Marco Jansen to Nitish Rana, , ah that's a harsh call from the umpire. Slower one angled in, Rana moves across the stumps, looks to sweep and misses. It only just misses leg stump. No surprise that SRH have gone for a review against the wide call. Now this is interesting, the third umpire upholds the decision, despite the fact that Rana clearly stepped across the stumps. Had he stayed in his original stance, it would've easily hit him on the pad
Marco Jansen to Nitish Rana, no run, Rana backs away, Jansen follows him and Rana mistimes the drive to mid-off

Marco Jansen to Nitish Rana, 1 run,  Some of the catching tonight has been really poor! It's Washington Sundar this time who fails to hold on. Slower bouncer, Rana looks to pull, skies it off a thick top-edge. It goes very high and Washington has a lot of time to settle under it. But he puts it down
Marco Jansen to Rinku Singh, no run, cracking yorker, Rinku squeezes it to point
Marco Jansen to Rinku Singh, , , full toss on the pads,  He swings hard and whacks it over square leg. And to make things worse, it's a no ball

Marco Jansen to Rinku Singh, , another six! Another six from Rinku Singh, his third of the night! Slower one outside off, Jansen tries to keep it out of his reach, but Rinku is still able to get to it. He reaches out and clobbers it over extra cover. Here we go again
Timeout! 70 needed off 24, required rate of 17.5, and yet KKR are not out of it. This is within RInku Singh territory
Has to be said that Nitish Rana has stepped up beautifully in Shreyas Iyer's absence for KKR
T Natarajan to Nitish Rana, no run, quite full around off, Rana looks for a reverse-scoop but misses. The ball only just misses off stump by a whisker
T Natarajan to Nitish Rana, no run, quite full around off, Rana looks for a reverse-scoop but misses. The ball only just misses off stump by a whisker
T Natarajan to Nitish Rana, , Natarajan misses the yorker, offers a full toss and gets hammered down the ground! Rana with a clean swing of the blade sends it sailing into the crowd
T Natarajan to Nitish Rana,  Caught!!

T Natarajan to Nitish Rana,  Caught by Washington Sundar!! Full toss again, but Rana hits it straight to hand this time! Line is outside off, he goes hard at it and smashes it to sweeper cover. No mistake from Washington this time. Oh Nitish Rana. He played so well, and has got out to such a hittable delivery.
T Natarajan to Thakur, 1 run, brilliant yorker on leg, Thakur squeezes it through square leg
T Natarajan to Rinku Singh, 1 run, low full toss outside off, slapped to deep point
T Natarajan to Thakur, , ! Low full toss down leg, Thakur only has to get some bat and it runs away past short fine leg
Bhuvneshwar to Rinku Singh, , Bhuvneshwar goes for a wide yorker but fails to keep it within the marker. Rinku leaves it alone
This is Bhuvi's last over. The options for SRH after this are Natarajan and Umran, unless they go to spin which will probably won't happen
Bhuvneshwar to Rinku Singh, 1 run, low full toss on the pads, Rinku flicks it through midwicket
Bhuvneshwar to Thakur, ,  Slower length ball, Thakur swings hard, gets deceived by the lack of pace but gets four anyway
Bhuvneshwar to Thakur, no run, slower leg-cutter wide of off, Thakur looks to slog but he's beaten! Brilliant from Bhuvneshwar to keep it out of his reach
Bhuvneshwar to Thakur, 1 run, banged in short now to vary it up. Lovely stuff. Thakur mistimes the pull through midwicket
Bhuvneshwar to Rinku Singh, 1 run, low full toss on the pads, Rinku flicks it to square leg and goes through for the single. Direct hit would've probably had him

Bhuvneshwar to Thakur, 2 runs,  Slower leg-cutter outside off, Thakur swings hard, and slices it in the air over extra cover. Markram has to run back from the circle as he goes after it. Would it have been easier for the converging fielder running in from the ropes? But Markram calls for it, puts in a diving effort but puts it down
T Natarajan to Rinku Singh, 2 runs, low full toss wide of off, Rinku slices it wide of sweeper cover and charges back for two. There's a direct hit from the deep but he's home
T Natarajan to Rinku Singh, , another attempted wide yorker, turns out to be a low full toss and Rinku hammers it through backward point. It races away to the ropes

T Natarajan to Rinku Singh, 2 runs, close to the blockhole outside off, Rinku drives hard through extra cover, wants two at any cost and Shardul has to take the risk to get him back on strike. He makes it home in time

T Natarajan to Rinku Singh, 2 runs, close to the blockhole outside off, Rinku drives hard through extra cover, wants two at any cost and Shardul has to take the risk to get him back on strike. He makes it home in time

T Natarajan to Rinku Singh, 2 runs, close to the blockhole outside off, Rinku drives hard through extra cover, wants two at any cost and Shardul has to take the risk to get him back on strike. He makes it home in time
T Natarajan to Rinku Singh, no run,  He's late on the pull and gets hit on the glove. Shardul runs halfway down for a single but RInku sends him back
T Natarajan to Rinku Singh, no run,  He's late on the pull and gets hit on the glove. Shardul runs halfway down for a single but RInku sends him back
T Natarajan to Rinku Singh, , oh that's not a bad ball. Goes for a yorker on middle, gets it very full to stop Rinku from getting under it. But Rinku powerfully swipes it through midwicket for four
T Natarajan to Rinku Singh, , oh that's not a bad ball. Goes for a yorker on middle, gets it very full to stop Rinku from getting under it. But Rinku powerfully swipes it through midwicket for four
Excellent match-winning spell from Bhuvi! He has redeemed his death bowling ability
Excellent match-winning spell from Bhuvi! He has redeemed his death bowling ability

T Natarajan to Rinku Singh, , dropped! Glenn Phillips has dropped a sitter! Short of length around the waist, Rinku mistimes the pull in the air, should've been swallowed at deep midwicket. But Phillips, one of the best on the outfield, makes a mess of it.

T Natarajan to Rinku Singh, , dropped! Glenn Phillips has dropped a sitter! Short of length around the waist, Rinku mistimes the pull in the air, should've been swallowed at deep midwicket. But Phillips, one of the best on the outfield, makes a mess of it.
They needed 29 the other day. It's 32 today.
They needed 29 the other day. It's 32 today.
Umran Malik to Thakur,  Caught!!
Umran Malik to Thakur,  Caught!!

Umran Malik to Thakur,  Caught by Washington Sundar!! That should be the game for SRH! They now need 32 off 5, even RInku Singh can't do much about that. Slower length ball outside off, Thakur looks to slog and gets a thick edge. Comfortably taken at backward point.

Umran Malik to Thakur,  Caught by Washington Sundar!! That should be the game for SRH! They now need 32 off 5, even RInku Singh can't do much about that. Slower length ball outside off, Thakur looks to slog and gets a thick edge. Comfortably taken at backward point.
Umran Malik to Umesh Yadav, 1 run, short of length outside off, Umesh does what he does and takes a single as he taps it to point
Umran Malik to Umesh Yadav, 1 run, short of length outside off, Umesh does what he does and takes a single as he taps it to point

Umran Malik to Rinku Singh, no run, that's a good call from the umpire not to give a wide. The ball may have finished outside leg, but Rinku moved across. Length ball slanted in from round the wicket, Rinku looks to scoop but misses

Umran Malik to Rinku Singh, no run, that's a good call from the umpire not to give a wide. The ball may have finished outside leg, but Rinku moved across. Length ball slanted in from round the wicket, Rinku looks to scoop but misses
Umran Malik to Rinku Singh, no run, slower length ball outside off, Rinku pulls it on the bounce to deep square leg
Umran Malik to Rinku Singh, no run, slower length ball outside off, Rinku pulls it on the bounce to deep square leg

Umran Malik to Rinku Singh, , Rinku can't stop hitting sixes in the final over. It's off the top-edge, and goes flying over fine leg. Back of a length outside off, Rinku has a massive heave and Umran's pace takes it over

Umran Malik to Rinku Singh, , Rinku can't stop hitting sixes in the final over. It's off the top-edge, and goes flying over fine leg. Back of a length outside off, Rinku has a massive heave and Umran's pace takes it over

Umran Malik to Rinku Singh, 1 run, slower short ball wide of off, Rinku reaches out and flat-bats it to mid-off. Another brilliant knock from him tonight but it comes in a losing effort this time as SRH hold on by 23 runs

Umran Malik to Rinku Singh, 1 run, slower short ball wide of off, Rinku reaches out and flat-bats it to mid-off. Another brilliant knock from him tonight but it comes in a losing effort this time as SRH hold on by 23 runs

It wasn't to be for Rinku Singh tonight. The sixes still flowed from him, but it was well out of reach in the final over by the time he got on strike. It's a wonder KKR even got so close from where they were at the start of the chase. Bhuvneshwar and Jansen rattled them with the new ball as they slipped to 20/3. But a stunning counter-attack from Rana, which started with taking Umran Malik to the cleaners, and a late assault from Rinku, who else, got the crowd's hopes up. But the death bowling today was a lot better. Bhuvneshwar came back to bowl a terrific 15th and 18th over. Natarajan wasn't on the money the whole time, but he was good enough. And Umran closed it off after the early damage he took. Not to forget Mayank Markande's lovely spell through the middle as .

It wasn't to be for Rinku Singh tonight. The sixes still flowed from him, but it was well out of reach in the final over by the time he got on strike. It's a wonder KKR even got so close from where they were at the start of the chase. Bhuvneshwar and Jansen rattled them with the new ball as they slipped to 20/3. But a stunning counter-attack from Rana, which started with taking Umran Malik to the cleaners, and a late assault from Rinku, who else, got the crowd's hopes up. But the death bowling today was a lot better. Bhuvneshwar came back to bowl a terrific 15th and 18th over. Natarajan wasn't on the money the whole time, but he was good enough. And Umran closed it off after the early damage he took. Not to forget Mayank Markande's lovely spell through the middle as .

Thanks for the compliments on the run chase. I feel the way we bowled was not according to the plans. No matter what the wicket was like, this wasn’t a 230 wicket. One odd day you’ll get an innings like Rinku had the other day, but not everyday. We batted really well, we wanted to take the game deep and then you never know. Home advantage is one thing, but we know Eden Gardens tracks always play this way, we expected 200 to be a par score here and have been preparing that way, but we need to bowl better. Today, even the main bowlers were going for runs but I can’t be too critical because these are the same bowlers who will win me a game some other time. Very happy with the fight we showed but would have loved it more if we got two points as well.

One odd day you’ll get an innings like Rinku had the other day, but not everyday. We batted really well, we wanted to take the game deep and then you never know. Home advantage is one thing, but we know Eden Gardens tracks always play this way, we expected 200 to be a par score here and have been preparing that way, but we need to bowl better. Today, even the main bowlers were going for runs but I can’t be too critical because these are the same bowlers who will win me a game some other time. Very happy with the fight we showed but would have loved it more if we got two points as well.

We just wanted to get wickets up front, but the way they scored in the 6th over, they were equal to us (powerplay score). I am not a big fan of too many slower balls or variations. You just got to bowl in the right areas. Try to bowl according to the batter and the dimensions. Just wanted to back him (Umran for the final over) and he started the over with two good balls. (Pitch) Bad for bowlers for sure (chuckles). No, really good wicket for the batters. They can come hard and if you put the ball in the right areas you can get wickets as well. Top class innings (from Harry Brook), we needed that type of an innings from him. Having him among the runs is a big plus for us. He can take any team apart, that is why the management sent him to open the batting.

Feels good winning away from home. Was always going to be a tight game. With their firepower we knew the total wasn't safe. Our bowlers showed character. I was fortunate that we got off to a great start. Makes life easier. We bat quite deep so you get the freedom. We all know Harry - his ability we have seen. Giving a player like that the time to face a lot of balls. He's Mr. Reliable for sure (Bhuvi). Certainly helps the dressing room. It's a great bunch of guys. It's cricket at the end of the day, always going to teach you a lesson.

It's cricket at the end of the day, always going to teach you a lesson.

Was a special night. Thankfully we got over the line as well. Got a little tense in the middle. A lot of people say that opening the batting in T20 is the best time to bat. I'm happy to bat anywhere. I've had a lot of success batting at five. Made my name there. My four Test hundreds will have to be over this one. The crowd was phenomenal tonight. I enjoyed it. I was putting pressure on myself a little bit. You go on social media and people are calling you rubbish. There's a lot of Indian fans out there who'll say well done tonight. But they were slagging me off a few days ago. Glad I could shut them up to be honest.

Phew, we've had another cracking game! It saw 433 runs scored overall, a hundred from Harry Brook after three failures to start, a superb innings from Markram who took the spinners on when Brook was unable to, and then two blazing fifties from Nitish Rana and Rinku Singh to keep KKR in the hunt chasing 229. But it was probably Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Mayank Markande who made the difference with the ball. So that's a wrap from us here as SRH bounce back after their poor start to the season to win two in a row. Hope you enjoyed our coverage. This is Sagar Chawla signing off on behalf of Praveen, MS Ramakrishnan and Saurabh Shankar. Goodbye!
